trans-unit.source: Capture an image of a virtual machine running Linux using the CLI
trans-unit.target: Capture an image of a virtual machine running Linux using the CLI

trans-unit.source: Learn how to capture an image of an Azure virtual machine (VM) running Linux.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to capture an image of an Azure virtual machine (VM) running Linux.

trans-unit.source: How to Capture a Linux Virtual Machine to Use as a Template with the CLI
trans-unit.target: How to Capture a Linux Virtual Machine to Use as a Template with the CLI

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to capture an Azure virtual machine running Linux so you can use it like a template to create other virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to capture an Azure virtual machine running Linux so you can use it like a template to create other virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: This template includes the OS disk and any data disks attached the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This template includes the OS disk and any data disks attached the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: It doesn't include networking configuration, so you'll need to configure that when you create the other virtual machines that use the template.
trans-unit.target: It doesn't include networking configuration, so you'll need to configure that when you create the other virtual machines that use the template.

trans-unit.source: Azure treats this template as an image and stores it in your image list.
trans-unit.target: Azure treats this template as an image and stores it in your image list.

trans-unit.source: This is also where any images you've uploaded are stored.
trans-unit.target: This is also where any images you've uploaded are stored.

trans-unit.source: For more information about images, see <link><linkText>About Virtual Machine Images in Azure[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about images, see <link><linkText>About Virtual Machine Images in Azure[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Before You Begin
trans-unit.target: Before You Begin

trans-unit.source: These steps assume that you've already created an Azure virtual machine and configured the operating system, including attaching any data disks.
trans-unit.target: These steps assume that you've already created an Azure virtual machine and configured the operating system, including attaching any data disks.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't done this yet, see these instructions:
trans-unit.target: If you haven't done this yet, see these instructions:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>How to Create a Custom Virtual Machine[]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How to Create a Custom Virtual Machine[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>How to Attach a Data Disk to a Virtual Machine[]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How to Attach a Data Disk to a Virtual Machine[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Capture the Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: Capture the Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: Connect to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>How to Log on to a Virtual Machine Running Linux[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>How to Log on to a Virtual Machine Running Linux[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The VM can only be captured if the state is StoppedDeallocated.
trans-unit.target: The VM can only be captured if the state is StoppedDeallocated.

trans-unit.source: In the SSH window, type the following command to shutdown your VM:
trans-unit.target: In the SSH window, type the following command to shutdown your VM:

trans-unit.source: Note that one of the options for vm shutdown is -p, which will keep the compute resource upon showdown.
trans-unit.target: Note that one of the options for vm shutdown is -p, which will keep the compute resource upon showdown.

trans-unit.source: Do not enable this, as the VM must be deprovisioned in order to capture it.
trans-unit.target: Do not enable this, as the VM must be deprovisioned in order to capture it.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to capture your VM image:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to capture your VM image:

trans-unit.source: The VM must be deleted in order to capture the image.
trans-unit.target: The VM must be deleted in order to capture the image.

trans-unit.source: You can use --deleted or -t to do so.
trans-unit.target: You can use --deleted or -t to do so.

trans-unit.source: You can confirm that your image has been captured by checking your VM image list:
trans-unit.target: You can confirm that your image has been captured by checking your VM image list:

trans-unit.source: The | grep portion is optional, but will help you find your image more easily in the list.
trans-unit.target: The | grep portion is optional, but will help you find your image more easily in the list.

trans-unit.target: Here is a sample walkthrough of capturing a virtual machine including terminal output:

trans-unit.source: Visit the <link><linkText>Azure CLI documentation page[]</linkText><title></title></link> for more details and additional commands.
trans-unit.target: Visit the <link><linkText>Azure CLI documentation page[]</linkText><title></title></link> for more details and additional commands.
